criteria: Attempting or establishing a personal or romantic relationship with employees of the San Andreas Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation.
Requesting special privileges, out-of-work information, or favors from employees.
2.1.2.ic_punishment: A charge of Undue Familiarity results in a 1-3 point write-up or 9 days in disciplinary segregation at the discretion of the issuing employee.

2.1.3.charge: Possession, Use, or Sale of Tobacco Products
2.1.3.ic_punishment: A charge of Possession, Use, or Sale of Tobacco Product results in a 1-2 point write-up or 9 days in disciplinary segregation at the discretion of the issuing employee.

2.1.4.ic_punishment: A charge of Disrespectful Conduct results in a 1-2 point write-up or 9 days in disciplinary segregation at the discretion of the issuing employee.

2.1.5.ic_punishment: A charge of Insubordinate Behavior results in a 1-3 point write-up or 9 days in disciplinary segregation at the discretion of the issuing employee.

2.1.6.charge: Improper Usage of Commissary or Canteen Foodstuffs
criteria: Hoarding canteen or commissary. Inmates are permitted to keep snacks and only three fruit.
2.1.6.ic_punishment: A charge of Improper Usage of Commissary or Canteen Foodstuffs results in a 1-2 point write-up or 3 day in disciplinary segregation at the discretion of the issuing employee.

criteria: Transferring commissary items between inmates. This includes the transfer of items when an inmate is to leave the facility upon the conclusion of overturn of a sentence: commissary items are to be returned to the facility staff upon this.
2.1.6a.ic_punishment: A charge of Unauthorized transfer of Commissary results in a 1-2 point write-up or 3 day in disciplinary segregation at the discretion of the issuing employee.

criteria: Possession of pornographic materials, including any modeling material which shows nudity excluding swim wear.
Possession of books not on approved lists available from the institutional library.
Possession of any seditious material.
Possession of any radical political material.
2.1.7.ic_punishment: A charge of Possession of Prohibited Materials results in a 1-5 point increase and/or 7-21 days in disciplinary segregation at the discretion of the issuing employee.

criteria: Blocking vision into a cell or internal room with any covering. Interfering with surveillance or sight lines.
2.1.8.ic_punishment: A charge of Interfering in Unit Visibility results in a 1-2 point write-up or 9 days in disciplinary segregation at the discretion of the issuing employee.

criteria: Interfering with the duties of employees or government agents by repeated insubordinate behavior or refusing to carry out lawful orders.
2.2.2.ic_punishment: A charge of Obstruction of Official Duties results in a 3 point increase and 21 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.2.3.ic_punishment: A charge of Resisting Custody results in a 4 point increase and 30 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Using any commissary item outside of its prescribed purpose.
Creating intoxicants - "pruno."
Creating improvised stoves/tattoo guns.
Creating improvised needles.
2.2.4.ic_punishment: A charge of Misuse of Commissary results in a 4 point increase and 21 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Betting or gaming with money or other items of value.
2.2.5.ic_punishment: A charge of Gambling results in a 3 point increase and 15 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.2.6.ic_punishment: A charge of Possession of Contraband - Minor results in a 4 point increase and 42 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Damaging or destroying the property of another individual.
2.2.7.ic_punishment: A charge of Vandalism results in a 3 point increase and 21 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Willfully or negligently ignoring restricted area signs and passing into custody-staff only zones without consent of custody staff.
2.2.8.ic_punishment: A charge of Trespassing or Entering Unauthorized Zone results in a 5 point increase and 42 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.2.9.ic_punishment: A charge of Barricading results in a 7 point increase and 63 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.2.10.ic_punishment: A charge of Look-out or Alarm results in a 3 point increase and 9 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.2.11.ic_punishment: A charge of Intoxication/Influence results in a 4 point increase and 15 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.2.12.ic_punishment: A charge of Masturbation results in a 3 point increase and 3 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.3.2.charge: False Information to a Government Employee
2.3.2.ic_punishment: A charge of False Information to a Government Employee results in a 10 point increase and 90 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.3.3.ic_punishment: A charge of Theft results in a 5 point increase and 63 days in disciplinary segregation

2.3.4.ic_punishment: A charge of Assault results in a 7 point increase and 90 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.3.5.ic_punishment: A charge of Criminal Threats results in a 5 point increase and 42 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Possession of a controlled substance without prescription within ranges of 1-28 grams.
Possession of an illegal narcotic within ranges of 1-28 grams.
Possession of hazardous materials or chemicals. ("Gassing" cocktail)
Possession of personal information of an employee.
2.3.6.ic_punishment: A charge of Possession of Contraband - Major results in a 7 point increase and 90 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Issuing challenges, fighting words, or rude gestures to other inmates in an attempt to start a fight.
Disturbing the peace by shouting after being warned.
Disrupting the peace of a sleeping block.
2.3.7.ic_punishment: A charge of Provocative Behavior results in a 7 point increase and 63 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Willfully or negligently ignoring restricted area signs and passing into custody-staff only zones without consent of custody staff.
2.2.8.ic_punishment: A charge of Trespassing or Entering Unauthorized Zone results in a 5 point increase and 42 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Soliciting or requesting sexual favors.
Voluntary sexual conduct not involving penetration.
2.3.8.ic_punishment: A charge of Lewd or Dissolute Conduct results in a 10 point increase and 42 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Offering favors, money, valuables, or other material in exchange for favors from employees.
Soliciting contraband from employees.
2.3.9.ic_punishment: A charge of Bribery results in a 15 point increase and 130 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.3.10.ic_punishment: A charge of Extortion results in a 10 point increase and 90 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.3.11.ic_punishment: A charge of Sexual Intercourse results in a 10 point increase and 63 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.3.12.ic_punishment: A charge of Prostitution results in a 10 point increase and 90 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Slipping, avoiding, or interfering with restraints placed by custody staff.
Interfering with restraints on another inmate.
2.3.13.ic_punishment: A charge of Disregarding Restraints results in a 10 point increase and 63 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.3.14.charge: Assault/Battery of Staff and/or Correctional Officers
2.3.14.ic_punishment: A charge of battery or assault of staff or correctional officers results in a 15 point increase and 180 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Participating in a large-scale fight, riot, or unrest.
Planning or engaging in behavior that disrupts facility-wide operations, such as mass vandalism or strike.
2.4.2.ic_punishment: A charge of Riotous or Seditious Activity results in a 20 point increase and 270 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.4.3.ic_punishment: A charge of Escape results in an immediate 50 point increase and a mandatory minimum of 3 years in disciplinary or administrative segregation.

2.4.4.ic_punishment: A charge of Attempted Escape results in a 50 point increase and a mandatory minimum of 3 years in disciplinary or administrative segregation.

2.4.5.ic_punishment: A charge of Murder results in a 50 point increase and mandatory minimum of 5 years in administrative segregation. Charges to be pursued through San Andreas Courts for extended prison term.

criteria: Attempting to unlawfully kill another individual.
2.4.6.ic_punishment: A charge of Attempted Murder results in a 50 point increase and a mandatory minimum of 3 years in disciplinary segregation.

2.4.7.ic_punishment: A charge of Battery results in a 15 point increase with a mandatory minimum of 360 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.4.8.ic_punishment: A charge of Aggravated Battery results in a 20 point increase with a mandatory minimum of 2 years in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Unlawful physical force which results in permanent debilitating injury, grievous bodily harm, permanent scarring, or lameness.
2.4.9.ic_punishment: A charge of Mayhem results in a 30 point increase and a mandatory minimum of 3 years in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Unlawful physical force using a shiv, dirk, shiv, dagger, or other improvised weapon.
Unlawful physical force with an augment for fists, such as brass knuckles.
Threatening physical force with the usage of such an item.
2.4.10.ic_punishment: A charge of Assault with a Deadly Weapon results in a 30 point increase and a mandatory minimum of 3 years in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Possession of a tool or item which could be reasonably used to grievously injure another individual, such as a dirk, shiv, dagger, shank, or slicing tool.
2.4.11.ic_punishment: A charge of Possession of an Improvised Weapon results in a 15 point increase and a mandatory minimum of 270 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Possession of a firearm or makeshift projectile tool.
2.4.12.ic_punishment: A charge of Possession of a Dangerous Weapon results in a 50 point point increase and a mandatory minimum of 2 years in disciplinary segregation.

2.4.13.ic_punishment: A charge of Manufacture of a Dangerous Weapon/Tool results in a 10 point increase and a mandatory minimum of 180 days in disciplinary segregation.

2.4.14.ic_punishment: A charge of Arson results in a 15 point increase and a mandatory minimum of 270 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Causing wanton destruction of a cell or other room which would cause a cease in function or force the unit to become uninhabitable due to sanitation standards.
2.4.15.ic_punishment: A charge of Destruction of a Unit results in a 10 point increase and a mandatory minimum of 90 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Attempting to enter a facility whilst possessing illegal contraband.
Selling contraband of any type.
2.4.16.ic_punishment: A charge of Conveyance of Contraband results in a 15 point increase and a mandatory minimum of 180 days in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Forceful penetration without consent.
2.4.17.ic_punishment: A charge of Sexual Battery/Rape results in a 25 point increase and a mandatory minimum of 1 year in disciplinary segregation.

2.4.18.ic_punishment: A charge of False Imprisonment/Hostage Taking results in a 35 point increase and a mandatory minimum of 3 years in disciplinary segregation.

criteria: Unlawful possession of escape instruments, such as digging tools or key molds.
Possession of beyond one ounce of illegal narcotics or controlled substances. (28+ grams.)
2.4.19.ic_punishment: A charge of Possession of Contraband - High Risk results in a 25 point increase and a mandatory minimum of 1 year in disciplinary segregation.
